Spatial trajectory inference analysis tutorial¶

In this tutorial, we are using both spatial information and gene expression profile to perform spatial trajectory inference to explore the progression of Ductal Carcinoma in situ (DCIS) - Invasive Ductal Cancer (IDC)

Source: https://support.10xgenomics.com/spatial-gene-expression/datasets

1. Preparation¶

We are trying to keep it focus on spatial trajectory inference then every step from reading data to clustering, we will give the code here to easier for user to use

[32]:

import stlearn as st
st.settings.set_figure_params(dpi=120)
# Reading data
data = st.Read10X(path="/home/d.pham/10X/BCBA/")
# Save raw_count
data.layers["raw_count"] = data.X
# Preprocessing
st.pp.filter_genes(data,min_cells=3)
st.pp.normalize_total(data)
st.pp.log1p(data)
# Keep raw data
data.raw = data
st.pp.scale(data)
# Run PCA
st.em.run_pca(data,n_comps=50,random_state=0)


Normalization step is finished in adata.X
Log transformation step is finished in adata.X
Scale step is finished in adata.X
PCA is done! Generated in adata.obsm['X_pca'], adata.uns['pca'] and adata.varm['PCs']

[ ]:



[33]:

st.pp.neighbors(data,n_neighbors=25,use_rep='X_pca',random_state=0)

Created k-Nearest-Neighbor graph in adata.uns['neighbors']

[34]:

st.tl.clustering.louvain(data,random_state=0)

Applying Louvain clustering ...
Louvain clustering is done! The labels are stored in adata.obs['louvain']

[36]:

st.pl.cluster_plot(data,use_label="louvain",tissue_alpha=1,spot_size=5,show_legend=True)

[42]:

import numpy as np
data.uns["iroot"] = np.flatnonzero(data.obs["louvain"]  == str(6))[50]
st.spatial.trajectory.pseudotime(data,eps=50,use_rep="X_pca")

Created k-Nearest-Neighbor graph in adata.uns['neighbors']

2. Running the global trajectory inference¶

Here we called global trajectory because it does the same method of trajectory inference in single cell analysis.

We used PAGA and DPT to perform this step. It also does the function of sub-clustering.

To explore the progression of DCIS-IDC, we choose the root as cluster 6 (Ductal cells area). Also, We used high resolution image (2000x2000) the the eps parameter should be 50:

[66]:

st.pl.non_spatial_plot(data,use_label="louvain")

PAGA plot:

Gene expression (reduced dimension) plot:

Diffusion pseudotime plot:

This is the DPT visualization in tissue morphology

[71]:

st.pl.trajectory.pseudotime_plot(data,list_cluster="all",show_graph=True,node_alpha=1,tissue_alpha=1,edge_alpha=0.1,node_size=5)

3. Running the local trajectory inference¶

Here, we want to check the intra-DCIS progression.

First, the visualization of sub-clustering results of cluster 6 (DICS) would be showed by:

[73]:

st.pl.subcluster_plot(data,use_label="louvain",cluster=6,tissue_alpha=1)

The local trajectory could be constructed by this function. It calculate the spatio-temporal distance between each pair-wise of sub-clusters.

[43]:

st.spatial.trajectory.pseudotimespace_local(data,use_label="louvain",cluster=6)

st.pl.trajectory.local_plot(data,use_cluster=6,branch_alpha=0.2,reverse=True)

Screening PTS local graph...
Calculate the graph dissimilarity using Resistance distance...
The optimized weighting is: 0.55
Start construct trajectory for subcluster 6

4. Perform pseudo-time-space to reconstruct the progress of DCIS-IDC¶

[44]:

st.spatial.trajectory.pseudotimespace_global(data,use_label="louvain",list_cluster=[6,7])
st.pl.cluster_plot(data,use_label="louvain",show_trajectory=True,list_cluster=[6,7],show_subcluster=False)

Screening PTS global graph...
Calculate the graph dissimilarity using Laplacian matrix...
The optimized weighting is: 0.73
Start to construct the trajectory: 6 -> 7

[45]:

st.pl.trajectory.tree_plot(data)

5. Detect transition markers of clades and branches¶

[46]:

st.spatial.trajectory.detect_transition_markers_clades(data,clade=6,use_raw_count=True)

Detecting the transition markers of clade_6...
Transition markers result is stored in adata.uns['clade_6']

[47]:

st.spatial.trajectory.detect_transition_markers_clades(data,clade=13,use_raw_count=True)

Detecting the transition markers of clade_13...
Transition markers result is stored in adata.uns['clade_13']

[49]:

st.pl.trajectory.transition_markers_plot(data,top_genes=30,trajectory="clade_13")

[51]:

st.pl.trajectory.transition_markers_plot(data,top_genes=30,trajectory="clade_6")

We also can compare between 2 clades or branches

[52]:

st.spatial.trajectory.compare_transitions(data,trajectories=("clade_6","clade_13"))

The result of comparison between clade_6 and clade_13 stored in 'adata.uns['compare_result']'

[53]:

st.pl.trajectory.DE_transition_plot(data)

[54]:

st.pl.gene_plot(data,genes="ALB",use_label="louvain",use_raw_count=True,list_clusters=[6,7])

[64]:

st.pl.gene_plot(data,genes="HLA-A",use_label="louvain",use_raw_count=True,list_clusters=[6,7])
